Moving up will steadily bring me closer to the (3,4) apple without risking collisions or wall issues. With no obstacles in the column, heading UP is a reasonable and safe move to grab an apple and score.

Next move: UP.

1.rationale:
Thinking aloud:
• Our snake is at (3,2) and the apple at (3,4) is directly above us. 
• Moving UP takes us safely to (3,3) with no obstacles, keeping a clear path for the apple.
• The enemy snake is at (3,6), which is sufficiently far away to not interfere with our route.
• There are no walls or bodies in our way moving upward.
Thus, the safest and most beneficial move is to continue heading UP.

Next move: UP.

Thinking aloud:
• Currently, our snake (#1) is at (3,3) and we have a clear apple right above at (3,4).
• There are no walls or snake bodies blocking the upward step.
• The enemy snake’s head is at (2,6) (with its body at (3,6)), which is not interfering with our immediate move.
• Moving UP will directly get us the apple, allowing us to grow and score points.

Thus, the safest and most beneficial move is to move UP.

Next move: UP.

Let’s reassess the real board and our options:

– Our head is at (1,6), body occupies (2,6) and (3,6). We last moved LEFT from (2,6) to (1,6), so we cannot move RIGHT (that would run into our own body).  
– Apples are at (2,3), (7,3), (4,0), (9,0), (9,8). The closest by Manhattan distance is at (2,3) (distance 4).  
– From (1,6) a LEFT or UP move takes us farther away; only DOWN brings us closer. DOWN to (1,5) is clear.  

Next Move: DOWN  
Strategy for next turn: From (1,5) continue down toward y=3, then slip right to grab the apple at (2,3).

1.rationale:
I'll think aloud:

• My snake is currently at (3,4) with a body segment at (3,3). I just grew by eating the apple above.

• Looking at the board, several apples remain: one at (9,8), one at (9,0), one at (7,3), one at (2,3), and one at (4,0).

• The apple at (2,3) is very tempting—it’s almost adjacent to my tail. Although I can’t go directly downward since (3,3) is occupied by my body, I can maneuver toward (2,3).

• From my head at (3,4), if I move LEFT, I’ll arrive at (2,4). That cell is free, and it positions me one column over from the (2,3) apple. On my following move, I could then move DOWN to collect it.

• There are no immediate hazards from walls or enemy snake segments nearby—the enemy’s head is at (1,6) with bodies at (2,6) and (3,6), which are far from my planned route.

Thus, targeting the apple at (2,3) seems a safe and beneficial strategy.

Next move: LEFT.
